data.title: SAGETV STP-HD200 INSTALLATION AND SETUP MANUAL Pdf Download
data.meta_description: View and Download SageTV STP-HD200 installation and setup manual online. HD Theater. STP-HD200 home theater system pdf manual download.
data.text:
Page 1 Ethernet network cable IR remote control and batteries This setup guide The STP-HD200 dimensions are approximately: 6 3/4” Wide x 1 1/2” High x 6” Deep, including the feet and connectors on the back. Doc Rev 1.0-A Copyright 2008 SageTV, LLC All rights reserved...

Page 2 SageTV HD Media Extender Model STP-HD200 The STP-HD200 HD Theater can be used in stand alone mode, as a media extender connected to a SageTV server over a local network, or as a Placeshifter client connecting to a SageTV server from a remote location.

Page 3 SageTV HD Media Extender Model STP-HD200 Video: Choose one type of video output ports to connect: HDMI, Component (Pr,Pb,Y), S- Video, or Composite. Turn on your TV and/or home theater equipment, making sure to set those devices to use the same audio and video connections used on the player.

Page 4 SageTV HD Media Extender Model STP-HD200 current resolution. For each valid resolution, check-mark its button to enable it. Then, when using the player in client mode (connected to a SageTV server), use the Video Out button to toggle the output resolution between the ones check-marked here. 2) The current resolution set on the resolution selection menu will be used as the default resolution when connecting to a SageTV server.

Page 5 SageTV HD Media Extender Model STP-HD200 option, then configure the Windows File Server Workgroup and Network Name. System Information – Displays status information about the HD Theater. Refresh Imported Media – Forces a scan of all the media import folders to look for new or updated media files.

Page 6 Refresh to search for available servers again. o Use the Edit Server List option to add remote servers that the player can connect to. The STP-HD200 HD Theater can be used as a Placeshifter client when connecting to a remote SageTV server from this list.

Page 7: Attached Devices

SageTV HD Media Extender Page 7 Model STP-HD200 Attached Devices In addition to playing media files found on a local network, the HD Theater can access media files on USB storage devices attached directly to the player. Accessing External Storage Devices from the Player External storage devices can be attached to the USB2 port on the the front and/or back of the unit.

Page 8 SageTV HD Media Extender Page 8 Model STP-HD200 discussion forum at forums.sagetv.com/forums. For SageTV technical support, submit a support request at www.sagetv.com/request.html and we will reply within 72 hours. Installing a SageTV Server Upgrade If the player is connected to a SageTV server: when SageTV is closed on the server for an upgrade install, the HD Theater will go into standby mode.

Page 9 SageTV HD Media Extender Model STP-HD200 If the TV is connected via component and there is no video output after changing the resolution five or more times via the Video Out button, see if the HDMI port is also connected on the player.

Page 10 Page 10 Model STP-HD200 STP-HD200 Warranty The STP-HD200 is covered by a one year warranty. If the player is not working correctly, please check the troubleshooting tips listed above, then contact SageTV technical support via www.sagetv.com/support.html. Copyright 2008 SageTV, LLC All rights reserved For additional support, go to www.sagetv.com/support.html...

Page 11: Remote Control Layout

SageTV HD Media Extender Model STP-HD200 Remote Control Layout Toggle between playing media & the last menu Main Menu Music Menu Photo Menu Numeric entry keypad - (dash) Change Audio language Volume Up/Down Options Go Back to the previous screen...

Page 12: Fcc Statement

SageTV HD Media Extender Page 12 Model STP-HD200 FCC Statement This device complies with Part 15 of the FCC Rules. Operation is subject to the following two conditions: (1) This device may not cause harmful interference, and (2) this device must accept any interference received, including interference that may cause undesired operation.
